channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-3841] 'testTimeSlice_*(NetworkServerControlApiTest.java)' fails on Jvm1.5/vista, Jvm1.4/SunOS 5.11
item.description:
The failure was seen on Win Vista, Jvm 1.5 and SunOS 5.11, Jvm 1.4.

http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/Daily/jvm1.5/testing/testlog/vista/685949-suitesAll_diff.txt :

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I ran this test on vista with sun jdk 1.5 and didn't see a failure. Can you try running the test with this patch to give more info with the assertion.

This is the jvm I tried with:
java version "1.5.0_13"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_13-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_13-b05, mixed mode)

I run org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet._Suite with the patch.
Results in:
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/debug/DERBY-3841/
I also saw this failure on a couple of machines (Solaris 10, JDK 5 and JDK 6) and committed a patch similar to the one Kathey had posted to get more details before I noticed this issue.

The logic for collecting the output in BaseTestCase.assertExecJavaCmdAsExpected() looks broken:

while ((inStream.read(ca, 0, ca.length)) != -1)

{ output = output + new String(ca).trim(); }

Two problems:

1) the return value from Reader.read() is thrown away, so we don't know how many chars to use from the char array, and we may add junk to the string

2) the call to String.trim() may remove significant white space

The attached patch fixes it by using another String constructor which allows you to specify which parts of the char array to use, and by removing the calls to String.trim(). I don't see the failure any more when running with the patch.
